g.text: Today, developers face a binary choice for AI agent control:
Option A: Babysit every single command
Approve 15-30+ permission prompts per coding session. Breaks flow completely.
Option B: YOLO mode (no safety at all)
Zero oversight. Someone literally rm -rf'd their home directory. It made the news.
"AI tools are honestly unusable without running in yolo mode."
Graduated physical control via precision dial:
Quick answers, lightweight. Agent can act freely on small tasks.
Use: lookups, simple edits, formatting, one-line fixes
Use: code generation, refactoring, multi-file changes
Use: architecture decisions, complex debugging, security review
Use: feature implementation, test suite creation, migrations
Approve/Reject buttons remain active at every dial position.
Deep thinking does not mean blind trust.
Sources: Stack Overflow Developer Survey 2025, GitHub anthropics/claude-code Issues, Logitech Marketplace
Claude Code: Flash=haiku, Standard=sonnet, Deep=opus, Marathon=opus+extended-thinking
Generic: Maps to --temperature and --max-tokens via adapter config. Any agent, any model.

svg.text: DWG-003 // THINKING DEPTH CONTROL // SHEET 3 OF 8
WISPY CONSOLE // UNIVERSAL AI AGENT CONTROL SURFACE // LOGITECH ACTIONS SDK // HAUSOR LABS 2026
